summary: The New England Coastal Protection Act, introduced in the U.S. Senate, aims to prohibit oil and gas leasing on the Outer Continental Shelf off the coast of New England. The bill amends the Outer Continental Shelf Lands Act to prevent the Secretary from issuing leases for oil and natural gas exploration, development, or production in areas off the coasts of Maine, New Hampshire, Massachusetts, Rhode Island, and Connecticut. The legislation is sponsored by multiple senators.
